sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3} be two sets. Compute (A △ B) △ {2} and A △ (B △ {2}), where △ denotes the symmetric difference and {2} is a singleton set. Show that the two results are not equal so that the symmetric difference is not associative with respect to the Cartesian product.
